segments.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharituṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, without giving up these six qualities you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body.

segments.pli: Kammārāmataṃ, bhassārāmataṃ, niddārāmataṃ, saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ, indriyesu aguttadvārataṃ, bhojane amattaññutaṃ.
segments.en: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme appahāya abhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharituṃ.
segments.en: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body.

segments.pli: Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharituṃ.
segments.en: But after giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of the body.

segments.pli: Kammārāmataṃ, bhassārāmataṃ, niddārāmataṃ, saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ, indriyesu aguttadvārataṃ, bhojane amattaññutaṃ.
segments.en: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharitun”ti.
segments.en: After giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of the body.”
